Standard Poodle.description: The first and largest breed of poodle, first bred as hunting companions. They are thin with a curly coat of fur, at least 15 inches tall, and weigh 40-70 pounds on average.

Miniature Poodle.description: The much smaller counterpart to standard poodles, only 10-15 inches tall and the same number of pounds. They have a wide variety of colors and are a popular choice as an apartment companion.

Toy Poodle.description: The newest breed of poodle, developed in the 20th century. They weigh just 4-6 pounds and are under 10 inches tall. You frequently see them riding around in their owners' handbags.
